verses.text: 你們當聽耶和華所說的話：「你要起來，向大山爭辯，讓小山可以聽見你的聲音。

words.note: Indicates the object of the verb '說' (said by LORD).
Here, 'contend' in a legal or covenantal sense.
Implies successfully hearing.

verses.text: 大山啊！你們要聽耶和華的爭辯。大地永久的根基啊！你們要聽，因為耶和華與他的子民爭辯，和以色列爭論。

words.note: Here, used as a noun, 'the LORD's case'.
Often used in elevated or formal contexts.
Figurative for the established order of the world.
Refers to God's chosen people.
Here, used as a verb, 'to dispute a case'.
Similar to 爭辯, but can be less formal or intense.

verses.text: 我的子民啊，我向你作了甚麼呢？我在甚麼事上叫你厭煩呢？你可以回答我。

words.note: In a spiritual sense, to cause annoyance or disgust.

verses.text: 我曾經把你從埃及地領上來，把你從為奴之家贖出來；我也差派了摩西、亞倫和米利暗在你前面行。

words.note: Implies leading from a lower to a higher place.
Literally 'to be a slave'.
Literary equivalent of '的'.
Often used for sending by authority or divine commission.

verses.text: 我的民哪！你們要追念，摩押王巴勒圖謀過甚麼，比珥的兒子巴蘭又答應了他甚麼，以及你們從什亭到吉甲所發生的事，好使你們知道耶和華公義的作為。」

words.note: Used here in the biblical context 'my people'.
More formal than '記得' (jìde), often implies solemn remembrance.
Often implies malicious or secretive planning.
Indicates a past experience.
Indicates the object of the verb '發生' (that which happened).
Often used to introduce a purpose or result clause.
Refers to actions or accomplishments.

verses.text: 我朝見耶和華，在至高的 神面前叩拜，當獻上甚麼呢？我朝見他的時候，當獻上燔祭，當獻上一歲的牛犢嗎？

words.note: Lit. 'to have an audience with'
Reverent term for God
Lit. 'to have an audience with'

verses.text: 耶和華喜悅千千的公羊，或是萬萬的油河嗎？為我的過犯，我可以獻上我的長子嗎？為我的罪惡，獻上我親生的孩子嗎？

words.note: Reduplication for emphasis
Reduplication for emphasis
Metaphorical for abundance of oil

verses.text: 世人哪！耶和華已經指示你甚麼是善，他向你所要的又是甚麼；無非是要你行公義，好憐憫，謙虛謹慎與你的 神同行。

words.note: Forms a nominal phrase 'what is V-ed'
Pronounced hào (4th tone) when meaning 'to love'
Reverent term for God

verses.text: 聽啊！耶和華向這城呼叫，敬畏你的名就是智慧；支派和城裡的會眾啊！你們要聽。
我怎能忘記惡人家中的不義之財，和那些可咒詛的小升斗呢？

words.note: Literary possessive/attributive particle
Historical units of capacity, here implying dishonest measurement

verses.text: 用不義的天平，和袋中詐騙的法碼的人，我怎能算他為清潔呢？

words.note: Lit. 'not righteous'
Lit. 'heavenly balance'
Nominalizes the preceding phrase to describe '人'.
Indicates role or state (consider him as...)

verses.text: 城裡的財主充滿了強暴，其中的居民也說假話；他們口中的舌頭是詭詐的。
因此我擊打你，使你生病（「我擊打你，使你生病」或參照《七十士譯本》和其他古譯本作「我開始擊打你」），因你的罪惡，使你荒涼。
你要吃，卻吃不飽；因你的腹中常有疾病。你要懷孕，卻不能生下來；你生下來的，我都要交給刀劍。

words.definition: not be full, not eat enough

words.note: Used here as an adjective, 'that which is born'.

verses.text: 你要撒種，卻不得收割，你要榨橄欖油，卻不得油抹身；你要榨葡萄汁，卻不得酒喝。

words.note: Refers to applying oil to the body, often ritually.

verses.text: 你跟隨了暗利的規例和亞哈家一切所行的，順從了他們的計謀；因此，我必使你荒涼，使你（「你」原文作「她」）的居民被嗤笑；你們也必擔當我民的羞辱。

words.note: Refers to established laws or customs.
A formal way to say 'what was done'.
Often implies cunning or sinister plans.
Used here to indicate an alternative reading in the original text.
Implies contemptuous laughter.
